p: High amylose corn and potato starches nanocarriers with granular structure and particle sizes ranging from 32.04 to 99.2 nm were used to encapsulate vitamin D 3, and their EE ranged from 22.34 to 94.8%. By using ultrasonic treatment, an increase of the hydrocarbon chain length was observed resulting in van der Waals and H-bonds of vitamin D 3 with the potato starch and greater thermal stability [ 90]. Low-molecular-weight octenyl succinic anhydride modified starches were reported to be suitable to form stable vitamin E nanocapsules for potential application in beverages [ 91].
